Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 13.4 and σ = 1.3. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 20% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 12.3059
* 12.5588
* 12.7783
* 12.8785

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 12.3059: Correct
* 12.5588: Incorrect
* 12.7783: Incorrect
* 12.8785: Incorrect
